artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Daikokuya Kinjirō; Carver: Yokogawa Takejirō
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: second sheet from the right of a vertical ōban pentaptych
markings: combined date and censor seal: 申九改 {saru kyū aratame} (Monkey 9 inspected) | publisher\'s seal: 大 {Dai} | carver\'s seal: 彫竹 {hori Take}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Assembly to Practice the Three Towers (San'yagura keiko no ôyose 三櫓稽古之大会)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
text: This pentaptych which misses the first sheet (far right) is titled Assembly to Practice the Three Towers. Behind the stage, the most famous kabuki actors of the day are rehearsing scripts. They were written by the three renown playwrights referred to in the title as Towers: Segawa Jokō III (1806-81), Kawatake Mokuami (1816-93), and Sakurada Jisuke III (1802-77). Collectors of prints like this could easily identify the actors by their faces but not so much the playwrights, hence red cartouches with their names were placed besides them.
title: Actors Ichikawa Danzō VI, Ichikawa Ichizō III, Onoe Waichi II, Ichikawa Dannosuke V, Sawamura Tanosuke III, and Asao Yoroku II
